Similar to Scandinavian paganism, with parallel gods and practices, it nonetheless had its own unique practices and beliefs. The chief god of the pantheon is Wodan, also known as Wuotan, Woden, or Wotan, parallel to the Norse Odin. Other important deities include Frijjo, goddess of love, related to the Norse deity Freya, and Donar, god of thunder, related to the Norse Thor.

ßY*ß! Rome is not held by a Chalcedonian bishop following the Latin Rites, or
ßY*ß! Constantinople is not held by a Chalcedonian bishop following the Greek Rites

Manichaeism is a Gnostic religion founded by the alleged prophet Mani who was put to death by the Sassanid Shahanshah Bahram I in 277. His 'Religion of Light' incorporated elements of Christianity, Zoroastrianism, Buddhism and Gnosticism. At one point, Manichaeism spread far and wide, and was the biggest competitor with Christianity for replacing classical Paganism until it began to fade in the 6th century. Features:
ßY*ß! The Manichaean Archegos exists in the Old Gods and Charlemagne bookmarks, and may be restored later
ßY*ß! Manichaeans have their own holy festival, the Bema Feast
ßY*ß! Manichaeans may elect to dedicate themselves to a Shekhinah upon adulthood
ßY*ß! A new holy order that may be founded, called the Army of Light

The Messalians, or Euchites ('Those who Pray'), are a heretical Christian sect that originated in Mesopotamia, influenced by dualistic faiths like Zoroastrianism. Messalians believe that God can be perceived by the carnal senses, and that this perception is necessary to reach perfection. Each person is born with an inner demon, and only intense prayer can drive it out. They also believe that Lucifer is the elder son of God and a force for good, and that incest is sacred since it was practised by the children of Adam and Eve. They have no formal rites and no strict church hierarchy. Features:
ßY*ß! Messalians must pray to expel their personal demons
ßY*ß! Once the demons are driven out, they can achieve the status of Perfection
ßY*ß! Messalians may choose a patron saint to worship
ßY*ß! Messalians can create their own Holy Order, the Army of Lucifer
ßY*ß! The Patriarch of Antioch will automatically become the new religion head
ßY*ß! Messalians only recognize the Petrine Sees

Copts are miaphysite, stressing that Christ had but a single nature, but of both human and divine character. This stance split them off from the main branch of Christianity after the council of Chalcedon in 451. Though not viewed as outright heretics by Orthodox and Catholic Christians, it is a fine distinction. The nominal head of the Coptic Church is the Pope of Alexandria.
ßY*ß! Copts only recognize the three Petrine Sees
ßY*ß! Copts may opt to become Desert Fathers and Desert Mothers instead of monks and nuns
ßY*ß! Copts may choose between the Alexandrite and Antiochian schools of theology

column2: Gnyan'po Cho'ga, or 'Sacred Rites', are the Tibetan pre-Buddhistm shamanist beliefs. Tibetan shamanism believes in a three-levelled cosmos. The top level, home of benevolent gods, the middle level that is home to the sibda or 'lords of the soil' as well as the spirits of the dead and mortals and finally the lower level, the home of the snake gods.\nSymbolically a ladder or rope connects the middle and top levels of this cosmos together. The kings of these realms were considered divine and when their mortal body would die a complex burial ritual was completed to allow their soul to ascend the upper levels via this rope.\nOver time many of the traditions of this pagan belief system would become incorporated into the Tibetan variant of Buddhism, Bˆn

Bˆn is the Tibetan branch of Buddhism that arose from the amalgamation of ancient Tibetan beliefs and Indian Buddhism that had been sponsored in the 7th century in Tibet. While very similar in many ways to Buddhism this complex history allowed it to retain many of its ancient shamanistic beliefs and traditions that make it distinct to Indian Buddhism.\nThey believe in the reincarnation of the Dalai Lama and Panchen Lama. In addition they follow four traditions, Nyingama, Kagyu, Sakya and Gelug.
